basics.name: David Martinez
basics.label: Machine Learning Researcher
basics.summary: Undergraduate machine learning researcher specializing in computational imaging, multimodal biological foundation models, and large-scale systems for training and inference.

work.name: NVIDIA
work.position: GPU System Performance Data Scientist Intern
work.summary: Modeled GPU cluster behavior and developed tools to study performance bottlenecks in distributed ML workloads.
highlights: Architected hardware modeling tools to identify performance bottlenecks in GPU clusters.
Optimized distributed training and inference pipelines for large-scale machine learning workloads.

work.name: Apple Inc.
work.summary: Built scalable ML models and data pipelines to support experimentation and decision-making for production systems.
highlights: Designed scalable ML models and SQL pipelines unifying heterogeneous datasets for robust A/B and causal analysis.
Supported production decision-making and recommendation systems through end-to-end experimentation workflows.

work.name: Microsoft
work.summary: Worked on distributed systems and applied ML research to improve LLM inference efficiency.
highlights: Conducted applied research on optimizing LLM inference and distributed systems, achieving measurable improvements in runtime efficiency and resource utilization.
Implemented parallel Scala/Python data-processing pipelines with Spark on heterogeneous GPU/CPU clusters.
Developed token-compression architectures for long-context inference under fixed compute budgets.

work.name: UC Berkeley Department of Electrical Engineering & Computer Sciences
work.summary: Course staff for the core undergraduate machine learning course at UC Berkeley.
highlights: Graded assignments and projects for a large-enrollment machine learning course.
Answered student questions and supported course logistics.

work.name: Berkeley Computational Imaging Lab
work.summary: Researching mixed-domain deep learning methods for inverse problems in MRI, optics, and computational imaging under Prof. Laura Waller.
highlights: Developed mixed-domain deep learning methods for inverse problems in MRI, optics, and computational imaging, leveraging mathematical priors and signal constraints for reconstruction from undersampled measurements.

Explored improvements to implicit neural rendering techniques via Gaussian Splatting and NeRF frameworks, using refined initializations and custom camera models to support large-scale biological and microscopy datasets.

volunteer.summary: Founded and led Berkeley’s ColorStack chapter to support underrepresented CS students.
highlights: Built a community supporting 100+ underrepresented CS students through mentorship, technical workshops, and career events.
Organized events that helped members secure internship roles across industry and research.

volunteer.summary: Mentored students on applied AI research projects in collaboration with academic PIs.
highlights: Mentored undergraduate and high school students in collaboration with PIs from Meta FAIR and UC San Diego.
Guided students through project scoping, experimental design, implementation, and technical writing.

volunteer.summary: Tutored SEED Scholars in technical coursework.
highlights: Provided one-on-one support in machine learning and convex optimization to undergraduate students.
Helped students develop stronger mathematical foundations for advanced coursework.

volunteer.summary: Mentored underrepresented STEM students on academics, research, and careers.
highlights: Advised scholars on coursework planning, research pathways, and career preparation.
Supported mentees in navigating research opportunities and internships.

education.area: Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences, Minor in Mathematics

awards.title: SEED Honors Scholar
awards.summary: Selected as a SEED Honors Scholar, a program supporting underrepresented students in STEM through mentorship, community, and research opportunities.

publications.name: Automated Neuron Labelling Enables Generative Steering and Interpretability in Protein Language Models
publications.summary: Introduces automated neuron labeling methods to steer and interpret protein language models, enabling more controllable sequence generation and mechanistic insights.

publications.name: SafeGenie: Erasing Dangerous Concepts from Biological Diffusion Models
publications.summary: Proposes a method for removing toxic protein-generation capabilities from biological diffusion models while preserving benign behavior.

publications.name: Mitigating Forgetting in Continual Learning with Selective Gradient Projection
publications.summary: Introduces a selective gradient projection approach to reduce catastrophic forgetting in continual learning settings.

publications.name: HierACT: Hierarchical Circuit Discovery for Interpretable Alzheimer’s Classification with Geometry-Aware Vision Transformers
publications.summary: Develops a geometry-aware vision transformer framework with hierarchical circuit discovery for interpretable Alzheimer’s disease classification from neuroimaging data.

projects.name: SafeGenie: Removing Toxic Protein-Generation Capabilities from Protein Diffusion Models
projects.summary: Developed methods to erase dangerous concepts from protein diffusion models while preserving useful generative behavior; presented as an oral at the NeurIPS BioSafe GenAI Workshop.
highlights: Designed interventions to suppress toxic sequence generation in biological diffusion models.
Evaluated safety-performance trade-offs under realistic biological constraints.

projects.name: Automated Neuron Labeling for Steering and Interpretability in Protein Language Models
projects.summary: Built tools for neuron-level analysis and steering of compact protein language models; accepted as a Spotlight at ICML GenBio 2025.
highlights: Implemented neuron-labeling pipelines to associate internal units with human-interpretable biochemical concepts.
Demonstrated generative steering of protein sequences using labeled neurons.

projects.name: Torch Interlacer
projects.summary: Open-source implementation of mixed-domain neural networks for phase retrieval and computational imaging.
highlights: Contributed to a PyTorch library for mixed-domain deep learning in imaging inverse problems.
Supported experiments on phase retrieval and MRI reconstruction with physics-informed architectures.

projects.name: DeltaCAT
projects.summary: Open-source toolkit for scalable data versioning and transformation in the Ray ecosystem.
highlights: Contributed to distributed data-processing utilities within the DeltaCAT project.
Improved support for large-scale dataset handling in ML and analytics workflows.

projects.name: ESM Neuron Explanations Dataset
projects.summary: Maintainer of a Hugging Face dataset hosting neuron-level explanations for compact protein language models.
highlights: Curated and maintained a dataset of neuron explanations to enable downstream mechanistic interpretability research.
Integrated dataset with public protein language model tooling for community use.
